intro: Ivodea ravelonarivoi, commonly known as the Madagascar ivy, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its trailing growth habit and small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Ivodea ravelonarivoi is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of its native habitat and is often found growing in shaded, moist environments.
